intro: Adonis shikokuensis, commonly known as the Shikoku adonis, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three deeply lobed leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish-green fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
